thread.title: WPBSA International Championship: China's Number 1 survives scare in qualification match
thread.title_full: WPBSA International Championship: China's Number 1 survives scare in qualification match

title: WPBSA International Championship: China's Number 1 survives scare in qualification match
text:
WPBSA International Championship: China's Number 1 survives scare in qualification match 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
Snooker International Championship is underway in Da Qing, China and the opening match would feature local favourite Ding Junhui taking on semi-professional potter Sam Craigie. 2013 winner Ding was expected to cruise in his first test at the third ranking event of the year, but things would not go so smoothly for the Chinese cue master.In the opening frame, Ding starts in top form and leaves Craigie with no chance as he wraps it up 82-0, but not before coming close on a difficult bank shot. Ding would continue rolling and take the second frame, but Craigie shows some life and opens his account by winning the third with a break of 75.The Chinese would claim the fourth with a top break of 98 for a 3-2 lead, but Craigie is in control in the sixth frame and manages to level the match 3-3.Not exactly the easy match that Ding had hoped for. They would exhcange the next two frames and the biggest battle of the night would play out in the ninth where Ding's experience would shine through as he splits the reds and takes control for a 5-4 lead.From there China's number one would end any hopes of a comeback as he safely takes the frame to eliminate Craigie in the qualification round by a score of 6-4.The other notable match of the night saw China's Tian Pengfei stun the defending champion Ricky Walden, with a top break of 106 in the fourth frame the youngster eliminated the title holder 6-4.
